title: Boeing resets Starliner plan to be ready for first NASA crew flight by March
description: Starliner continues to be a costly and behind-schedule endeavor for Boeing, with the company absorbing about $1.5 billion in cost overruns to date.

title: Lucid misses revenue expectations after EV deliveries disappoint
description: Lucid's second-quarter revenue fell short of expectations, but a recent cash raise extended the EV maker's runway into 2025.

title: Palantir reports 13% revenue growth, issues guidance that tops estimates
description: Palantir executives say revenue growth will accelerate in the third quarter, reversing a trend from the last several years.

title: 34-year-old Kickstarter CEO credits his success to 2 soft skills: They make you 'a better leader'
description: Kickstarter CEO Everette Taylor says two soft skills helped him build a career and land the crowdfunding platform's top job: risk-taking and empathy.

title: Zoom can now train its A.I. using some customer data, according to updated terms
description: Zoom's update comes amid growing public debate on the extent to which AI services should be trained on individuals' data.

title: Elon Musk says he may need surgery
description: Elon Musk said he may require surgery and is getting an MRI of his neck and upper back.

title: Berkshire shares hit all-time high as investors cheer strong earnings, Buffett's near-record cash pile
description: Berkshire's solid performance in insurance helped offset the softness in railroad due to lower volumes.

title: Warren Buffett's protégé was hired after sending the billionaire a letter—but it wasn't just luck
description: Tracy Britt Cool was hired at Berkshire straight out of business school after she wrote a letter to Warren Buffett. It wasn't the only letter she sent.

title: Apple's iPhone 15 is reportedly set for mid-September launch
description: The new iPhone will launch after a September Apple event and will come just in time for the holidays.

title: Tesla CFO Zach Kirkhorn steps down
description: Zach Kirkhorn, Tesla's chief financial officer, stepped down from his role but will remain with the company through the end of the year.

title: Global ocean temperatures are now hotter than ever — with far-reaching consequences for the planet
description: The world's oceans are a critical life support system and a vital buffer against the impacts of the climate crisis.

title: Niger hangs in the balance as junta ignores ultimatum from West African bloc
description: Niger's coup leaders on Monday closed its airspace, after an ultimatum from the Economic Community of West African States to restore constitutional order expired on Sunday night.

title: Oil giant Saudi Aramco posts 38% drop in second-quarter profit as lower prices bite
description: The recent decline in profitability was in line with industry trends and a broader decline in oil prices in the first half of this year.

title: Shares of China's second largest chip foundry Hua Hong jump 13% in Shanghai debut
description: Shares of Chinese chipmaker Hua Hong jumped 13% at the open during its debut on Shanghai Stock Exchange's Nasdaq-style Star Market on Monday.

title: Siemens Energy CEO on $2.4 billion wind turbine hit: We were 'going too fast' with new products
description: Siemens Energy has booked 2.2 billion euros ($2.4 billion) in costs due to quality issues at its wind turbine unit.

title: CNBC Daily Open: A good economy doesn’t mean positive markets
description: The U.S. economy’s had an unbroken string of victories. Yet markets slumped Friday. This reminds us that the two aren't the same.

title: Oil prices surge to 4-month highs after Saudi, Russia output cuts
description: Oil prices rose on Monday to reach their highest since mid-April following an extension of production cuts by Saudi Arabia and Russia.

title: How U.S. microchips are fueling Russia's military — despite sanctions
description: Moscow is sourcing a growing number of advanced microchips from the West through intermediary countries such as China, analysis by CNBC shows.

title: How — and when — Ukraine's war with Russia could end
description: It's become abundantly clear that Ukraine's counteroffensive won't produce quick results. And Western governments could be supporting Ukraine into 2025.

title: Australia urges China to remove all trade restrictions after barley tariffs lifted
description: Canberra is expecting Beijing to next drop Australian wine tariffs introduced in March 2021.

title: Over $1 trillion needed for developing nations' climate transition, says ex-World Bank official
description: The lack of resources has made it challenging for those countries to reduce their high carbon emissions and shift to clean energy faster, she noted.

title: Vietnam's EV ownership will see 'strong growth' in 2023, says new report
description: A new BMI Research report said that Vietnam's EV ownership will see strong growth in 2023.
